result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court orders bench warrant to issue for the defendant.  Court ordered that the defendant is to be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant.  Court does not address bail at this time.

Defendant Jeremy Miles Polley in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court to follow up with JP violation. No further action taken. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy Miles Polley in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris via zoom.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for justice point violation.  The court addressed the defendant violations.  The Court order the defendant to report to Justice Point for testing.  The Court order the matter adjourned back to branch 2.

Defendant Jeremy Miles Polley in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for bail hearing. For reasons stated, bail hearing adjourned for an in-person hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 1, 2022 - received

Defendant Jeremy Miles Polley in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court to address violation. Defense counsel unable to appear. Court orders defendant to appear in person at next court date.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Violation Report

Defendant Jeremy Miles Polley in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report
Pretrial Services Supervision Report
signed Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Jeremy Miles Polley in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel. Court appoints attorney Thomas Harris, present in court/in court via telephone, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning 06-01-20202, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing on 04-18-2022 at 8:30 am, Branch PE.

Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for LEVEL 5 supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test.
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Jeremy Miles Polley in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($3,500.00) LW
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 3500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jeremy Miles Polley not in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
